did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.
did.abstract: The collection contains programs, clippings, and fliers from organizations in which Dudley participated while a student at VPI, including the Dramatic Club, the Bugle, the Tech Minstrels, the Southwestern Virginia Chemical Club, and the YMCA.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Permission to publish material from the James Frederick Dudley Collection must be obtained from Special Collections, Virginia Tech.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: James Frederick Dudley Collection, Ms1949-002, Special Collections, Virginia Polytechnic Institute and State University, Blacksburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: The James Frederick Dudley Collection was donated to Special Collections prior to 1949.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The processing, arrangement, and description of the James Frederick Dudley Collection commenced and was completed prior to 2006. Additional description was completed in July 2009.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information
bioghist.p: James Frederick Dudley graduated from VPI in 1929 with a degree in Chemical Engineering. He was involved with the Dramatic and Chemical Clubs from his sophomore through senior years. During his senior year, he also served in the YMCA Cabinet and as the Photographic Manager of the Bugle.
See page 98 of the 1929 Bugle (page 106 of the pdf) for a senior photograph of Dudley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection contains programs, clippings, and fliers from organizations in which Dudley participated while a student at VPI, including the Dramatic Club, the Bugle, the Tech Minstrels, the Southwestern Virginia Chemical Club, and the YMCA.

A majority of this collection consists of ticket stubs, reviews, and news articles on Dramatic Club productions performed between 1927 and 1929, including "Miss Patricia," "Mrs. Bumpstead Leigh," "Charm School," and "Tech Scandals." Also included are materials relating to Dramatic Club-sponsored events, and the club constitution and proceedings.

YMCA materials include blank letterhead, news-clippings, and internal organization notes. Tech Minstrel materials relate to Bugle-sponsored concert events. The collection also includes Bugle letterhead. Chemistry Club ephemera relates to the completion of Davidson Hall and also contains a note denying Dudley's request to wear civilian clothes to a club banquet.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged by subject matter.

did.unittitle: Miscellany, including: band and football ephemera, dues receipts, and waitership lists, 1927-1929.
